titleStmt.title: J. Newt Turner, Jesse Stevens, and James C. Weller, Affidavit
CWG2515

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: We J Newt Turner Judge, Jesse Stevens sheriff and James C Weller clerk duly authorized to compare the poll books for the County of Caldwell, do certify that at an election held in said County on the 4th day of May 1861, T A Lovey was duly elected to fill the office of a justice of the peace in the first Precinct in the place of M Dudley who has resigned Given under our hands this 8th day of May 1861.

J Newt Turner P J
Jesse Stevens S. c c.
James C Weller clk

Princeton Ky June 13th 1861.
Mr B Magoffin
Govenor
Some six weeks ago I sent to the secretary of State a certificate of Mr Lovey's election, and he never has received his commissioner as yet. I wish you would attend to it, immediately
